solution: Since $\angle ABC$ is a straight angle, we have $6x + 3x = 180^\circ$, so $9x = 180^\circ$ and $x = 20^\circ$.  Therefore, $\angle ABD = 6x = \boxed{120^\circ}$.
model_solution:
Since $\angle ABC$ is a straight angle, we have $\angle ABC=180^{\circ}$.
Since $\angle ABC$ is a straight angle, we have $\angle ABC=180^{\circ}$, so $6x^{\circ}+3x^{\circ}=180^{\circ}$.
$9x^{\circ}=180^{\circ}$
$\frac{9x^{\circ}}{9}=\frac{180^{\circ}}{9}$
$x^{\circ}=20^{\circ}$
Since $\angle ABD$ and $\angle ABC$ are supplementary angles, we have $\angle ABD=180^{\circ}-\angle ABC$.
$\angle ABD = 180^{\circ} - 3x^{\circ}$
$\angle ABD = 180^{\circ} - 3x^{\circ}$
$= 180^{\circ} - 3(20^{\circ})$
$= 180^{\circ} - 60^{\circ}$
$= 120^{\circ}$
$\angle ABD=180^{\circ}-3x^{\circ}$
$\angle ABD = 180^{\circ} - 3x^{\circ} = 180^{\circ} - 3(20^{\circ})$
steps: Since $\angle ABC$ is a straight angle, we have $\angle ABC=180^{\circ}$.
Since $\angle ABC$ is a straight angle, we have $\angle ABC=180^{\circ}$, so $6x^{\circ}+3x^{\circ}=180^{\circ}$.
Since $\angle ABD$ and $\angle ABC$ are supplementary angles, we have $\angle ABD=180^{\circ}-\angle ABC$.
full_steps: Since $\angle ABC$ is a straight angle, we have $\angle ABC=180^{\circ}$.
Since $\angle ABC$ is a straight angle, we have $\angle ABC=180^{\circ}$, so $6x^{\circ}+3x^{\circ}=180^{\circ}$.
Since $\angle ABD$ and $\angle ABC$ are supplementary angles, we have $\angle ABD=180^{\circ}-\angle ABC$.
